definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Later, at home, Zilla would accuse him of being a coward and a weakling .
sentences.chinese: 等到了家裏，齊拉就數落他是個懦夫，軟骨頭。

sentences.english: Many times a coward before death, death of terror.
sentences.chinese: 懦夫在未死之前，已身歷多次死亡的恐怖了。

sentences.english: That may be true, but I can tell you that I won’t look the other way or run the other way like those cowards.
sentences.chinese: 也許會這樣，但我絕不會像那些懦夫一樣跑掉。

sentences.english: Cowards die many times before their deaths.
sentences.chinese: 懦夫在未死之前，已身歷多次死亡的恐怖了。

sentences.english: Restaurant, both met Xiao Hui being humiliated a coward.
sentences.chinese: 餐館裏，樂兒碰到蕭輝被別人羞辱懦夫。

sentences.english: We imagined we were being responsible but were only being cowardly.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲自已都很負責任，其實我們是懦夫。

sentences.english: He is nothing but a chicken-hearted dastard.
sentences.chinese: 他只是一個膽怯的懦夫。

sentences.english: But base and crafty cowards, are like the arrow that flieth in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 不過卑怯而狡猾的懦夫則往往想要暗中施放的冷箭。

sentences.english: They won't fight alone because they are cowards.
sentences.chinese: 他們不敢打架因爲它們都是懦夫。

sentences.english: She takes caution for cowardice and dissent for defiance.
sentences.chinese: 她謹防懦夫的暗箭，從挑釁中挖掘異議。
他只是一個別容易屈服的懦夫。

sentences.english: No, I will not empty the hells for you, coward.
sentences.chinese: 魔王不，我不會把所有魔軍都交給你，懦夫。

sentences.english: A faint heart never won a fair lady.
If you are a coward, you will eventually be looked down upon.
sentences.chinese: 你若是個懦夫，終究會被人瞧不起。

sentences.english: He had been assailed as a coward and a defeatist by his own friends.
sentences.chinese: 他被他的朋友們指爲懦夫和失敗主義者。

definition: greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
a turtle that pulls its head in/(fig.) coward/chicken
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
